definition[0]: to take off a piece of clothing in a quick careless way
example[0]: They threw off their clothes and dived in.
definition[1]: to get free from something that has been limiting your freedom
example[1]: In 1845, they finally threw off the yoke of foreign rule.
definition[2]: if you throw off an illness, you get better from it
example[2]: It’s taken me ages to throw off this cold.
definition[3]: to escape from someone or something that is chasing you
example[3]: We ran flat out for about half a mile before we could throw them off.
definition[4]: to produce large amounts of heat or light
example[4]: The engine was throwing off so much heat that the air above it shimmered with haze.
